Class Cell

java.lang.Object
Cell
public abstract class Cell extends Object
A class representing the shared characteristics of all forms of life
Version:
2023.02.28 (1)

  • Method Details

    • act

      public abstract void act()
      Make this cell act - that is: the cell decides it's status in the next generation.

      protected List<Cell> getNeighbours()
      Return all the cell's living neighbours
      Returns:
      A list of the cell's living neighbours

    • getCellCount

      protected int getCellCount(Class c)
      This returns the number of neighbours of a particular Cell subclass. Takes a class as a parameter (for example "Mycoplasma.class") and checks how many neighbours of that class the cell using this method has.
      Parameters:
      c -
      Returns:
      Number of neighbours of Class c.

    • getNearbyWhiteMaturity

      protected int getNearbyWhiteMaturity()
      A new white blood cell is considered "young" Check if the white blood cell is "mature" (returns 1) or "elder" (returns 2). Mature white blood cells can attack Mycoplasma cells. Elder white blood cells can attack Mycoplasma and Cancer cells.
      Returns:
      1 if the white blood cell is >= 6 generations old

    • replicableCancerNearby

      protected boolean replicableCancerNearby()
      Checks if a replicable cancer cell is nearby Cancer cells can replicate once evert 5 generations.
      Returns:
      true if there is a cancer cell neighbour with an age divisible by 5
